variants.Description in input context: A missense variant at position 1208, altering the protein structure.
A missense variant at position 1563, affecting mitochondrial function.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were used for immunofluorescence studies.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Reduced protein expression and altered mitochondrial morphology.
Readout description.Result Description: Immunofluorescence revealed reduced PINK1 expression and disrupted mitochondrial networks in cells harboring the c.1208C>T variant.  Quantitative analysis showed a ~30% reduction in fluorescence intensity compared to control cells.
The c.1563G>A variant was associated with elevated ROS levels, as measured by Dihydroethidium (DHE) staining.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with three independent biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Each condition was assessed with three technical replicates per sample.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells transfected with a wild-type PINK1 expression vector served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with an empty vector served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential within a range of 70-90 mV.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential less than 70 mV.
